newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Overheated Russia shares fall on economic doubts.
newsitem.headline: Overheated Russia shares fall on economic doubts.

text.p: Leading Russian shares edged down on Tuesday as overheated prices cooled down, traders said.

"Papers are slowly reaching the point where they are interesting to buy," said Alexei Toporkov, a trader from Alliance-Menatep, adding that shares like UES, Rostelekom and Mosenergo were already cheap enough.
He said Western investors would not buy at current levels due to political and economic instability in Russia.
An International Monetary Fund mission left Moscow on Tuesday without making any recommendations as to whether to pay Russia the next tranche of its $10 billion loan.
The communists on Sunday threatened to try and impeach Yeltsin or to call for a no-confidence vote in the government.
"There are several unpleasant issues on the market, first of all the situation with Rostelekom. I think Rostelekom is dragging the whole market down," said Yevgeny Turok, a trader from UFG.
Russia has dropped London-based investment bank N.M. Rothschild as adviser on the sale of a stake in telecoms holding company AO Svyazinvest, the State Property Committee said on Tuesday.
The statement did not say who would take over as adviser.
The Financial Times said on Tuesday that Russia's Alfa-Bank and Most-Bank would handle the sale in future.
The Committee said that, out of a series of options for selling Svyazinvest, the government had decided to transfer its 38 percent stake in Rostelekom to Svyazinvest.
Toporkov said the market's next direction would depend on news on the IMF decision, due to be taken in mid-December.
Yuganskneftegaz fell to $9.70 from $10.25 at Monday's close, Megionneftegaz was $2.33 after $3.37, UES edged down to $0.0822 from $0.0825 and Mosenergo rose to $0.980 from $0.994.
